The most frequently mentioned representative images include: Image 55 (a skull with Latin inscription), Image 4 (portrait of Gottfried Werner von Wildenstein from 1536 with religious/mortality themes), Image 18 (Crucifixion scene), and Image 38 (a funeral scene). The skull image (55) appears to be the most direct and explicit representation of Memento Mori with its literal skull symbol and Latin inscription about remembering death.
